# Base Types Docs

## Base types overview

- [Common type system](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/common-type-system.md): Explore the type system in .NET. Read about types in .NET (value types or reference types), type definition, type members, and type member characteristics.
- [Choose between anonymous and tuple types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/choosing-between-anonymous-and-tuple.md): Learn when it's appropriate to choose between anonymous types, and tuple type.

## Basic string operations

- [Create new strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/creating-new.md): Learn to create strings using assignment, class constructors, or System.String methods that combine several strings, arrays of strings, or objects in .NET.
- [Trim and remove characters](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/trimming.md): Learn to trim blank spaces from the beginning or end of a string, or remove any number of spaces or characters from a specified position in the string in .NET.
- [Pad strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/padding.md): Learn how to pad strings in .NET. Use the String.PadLeft and String.PadRight methods to add leading or trailing characters to achieve a specified total length.
- [Comparison methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/comparing.md): Read about methods to compare strings in .NET. Learn about the Compare, CompareOrdinal, CompareTo, StartsWith, EndsWith, Equals, IndexOf, & LastIndexOf methods.
- [Change case](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/changing-case.md): Learn how to change in the case of strings in .NET.
- [Separate parts of a string](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/divide-up-strings.md): Learn about different techniques to extract parts of a string, including String.Split, regular expressions, and String.Substring.
- [Use the StringBuilder class](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/stringbuilder.md): Learn how to use the StringBuilder class in .NET. Use this class to modify a string without creating a new object.
- [How to: Perform basic string manipulations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/basic-manipulations.md): See an example that calls many string methods.

## Behavior and performance

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/details-of-regular-expression-behavior.md): Learn more about: Details of regular expression behavior
- [Backtracking](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/backtracking-in-regular-expressions.md): Learn how to control backtracking in regular expression pattern matching.
- [Compilation and reuse](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/compilation-and-reuse-in-regular-expressions.md): Learn about compilation and reuse in Regular Expressions.
- [Source generation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-source-generators.md): Learn how to use regular expression source generators to optimize the performance of matching algorithms in .NET.
- [Best practices](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/best-practices-regex.md): Learn how to create efficient, effective regular expressions in .NET.

## Best practices

- [Comparing strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings.md): Learn how to compare strings effectively in .NET applications.
- [Displaying and persisting formatted data](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/best-practices-display-data.md): Learn how to display and persist numeric and date data effectively in .NET applications.

## Examples

- [Scan for HREFs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-example-scanning-for-hrefs.md): See an example of regular expressions in .NET. The example searches an input string and displays all href attribute values and their locations.
- [Change date formats](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-example-changing-date-formats.md): Learn more about: Regular Expression Example: Changing Date Formats
- [Extract a protocol and port number from a URL](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/how-to-extract-a-protocol-and-port-number-from-a-url.md): Learn more about: How to: Extract a Protocol and Port Number from a URL
- [Strip invalid characters from a string](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/how-to-strip-invalid-characters-from-a-string.md): Read an example that shows how to strip potentially harmful characters from a string by using the static Regex.Replace method.
- [Verify that strings are in valid email format](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/how-to-verify-that-strings-are-in-valid-email-format.md): Read an example of how a regular expression verifies that strings are in a valid email format in .NET.

## Format numbers, dates, other types

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md): Learn how to convert instances of .NET types to formatted strings. Override the ToString method, make formatting culture-sensitive, and use ICustomFormatter.
- [Standard numeric format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md): In this article, learn to use standard numeric format strings to format common numeric types into text representations in .NET.
- [Custom numeric format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md): Learn how to create a custom numeric format string to format numeric data in .NET. A custom numeric format string has one or more custom numeric specifiers.
- [Standard date and time format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md): Learn how to use a standard date and time format string to define the text representation of a date and time value in .NET.
- [Custom date and time format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md): Learn to use custom date and time format strings to convert DateTime or DateTimeOffset values into text representations, or to parse strings for dates & times.
- [Standard TimeSpan format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md): Review standard TimeSpan format strings, which use a single format specifier to define the text representation of a TimeSpan value in .NET.
- [Custom TimeSpan format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md): Understand custom TimeSpan format strings in .NET. A custom format string contains one or more TimeSpan format specifiers & any number of literal characters.
- [Enumeration format strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md): Create enumeration format strings using the Enum.ToString method in .NET. Format numeric, hexadecimal, or string values of enumeration members.
